Package io.artframework

Interface BootstrapScope

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataProvider, Scope
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BootstrapPhase
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultScope
    public interface BootstrapScope
extends Scope
    The bootstrap scope is used to configure the scopes configuration before it is initialized.

    The Configuration and Scope cannot be modified after bootstrapping has ended. Use the configure(Consumer) method to fine tune the configuration of the art-framework and to provide custom implementations for any of the configuration providers.

    Here is an example how you can provide a scheduler implementation: 

    
 scope.configure(config -> config.scheduler(new MyCustomScheduler()));

    • Method Detail

      • of

        static BootstrapScope of​(BootstrapModule module)
        Creates a new bootstrap scope with the given root module using the default settings.

        Use the bootstrap scope to start the bootstrap phase by calling ART.bootstrap(BootstrapScope).

        You can also provide your own settings, e.g. load them from a file by using the of(BootstrapModule, Settings) method.

        Parameters:
        module - the bootstrap module
        Returns:
        the create bootstrap scope

      • of

        static BootstrapScope of​(BootstrapModule module,
                         Settings settings)
        Creates a new bootstrap scope with the given root module and settings.

        Use the bootstrap scope to start the bootstrap phase by calling ART.bootstrap(BootstrapScope).

        Use this to customize the settings that are used for the scope. Otherwise use the default settings and call of(BootstrapModule) directly.

        Parameters:
        module - the bootstrap module
        settings - the settings that should be used for the scope
        Returns:
        the create bootstrap scope

      • bootstrapModule

        BootstrapModule bootstrapModule()
        Gets the module that initiated the bootstrap process.
        Returns:
        the bootstrap module

      • configure

        BootstrapScope configure​(java.util.function.Consumer<Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder> builder)
        Configures this bootstrap scopes configuration.

        Use it to provide your own implementations of the art-framework, e.g.: a StorageProvider or Scheduler replacement.

        Parameters:
        builder - the configuration builder
        Returns:
        this bootstrap scope
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the bootstrapping phase has already finished meaning bootstrap() was called

      • addProvider

        <TProvider extends Provider> BootstrapScope addProvider​(java.lang.Class<TProvider> providerClass,
                                                        java.util.function.Function<Scope,​TProvider> supplier)
        Registers a new provider implementation for the given class with the given provider.

        Existing providers matching the provider class type will be overwritten, but only if the class is an exact match.

        Use the addSingletonProvider(Class, Provider) method to register singleton providers or handle the lifetime of your provider with the calls to the provided supplier. 

        
 add(Scheduler.class, (scope) -> new BukkitScheduler(scope));
 // this will not overwrite the provider and both will be retrieved depending on the parameter of the get call
 add(BukkitScheduler.class, (scope) -> new BukkitScheduler(scope));
        Type Parameters:
        TProvider - the type of the provider
        Parameters:
        providerClass - the class of the provider
        supplier - the supplier that creates the provider
        Returns:
        this bootstrap scope

      • addSingletonProvider

        <TProvider extends Provider> BootstrapScope addSingletonProvider​(java.lang.Class<TProvider> providerClass,
                                                                 TProvider provider)
        Registers a new singleton provider for the given class.

        Existing providers matching the provider class type will be overwritten, but only if the class is an exact match.

        Use the addProvider(Class, Function) method to register providers with different lifetimes. 

        
 Scheduler scheduler = new BukkitScheduler();
 add(Scheduler.class, scheduler);
 // this will not overwrite the provider and both will be retrieved depending on the parameter of the get call
 add(BukkitScheduler.class, scheduler);
        Type Parameters:
        TProvider - the type of the provider
        Parameters:
        providerClass - the class of the provider
        provider - the provider instance that should be registered
        Returns:
        this bootstrap scope

      • bootstrap

        BootstrapPhase bootstrap()
                  throws BootstrapException
        Finishes the bootstrap process, seals the configuration and returns the created scope.

        This will create a Configuration from all of the provided implementations and bake it into the Scope.

        Returns:
        the scope that was created from the bootstrap process
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the bootstrapping phase has already finished meaning this was called already
        BootstrapException
